title.narrative: CO Rio Bogota Environmental Recuperation and Flood Control Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to assist the Borrower to transform the Rio Bogotá river into an environmental asset for the BogotáDistrito Capital metropolitan region by improving water quality, reducing flood risks, and creating multi-functional areas along the river.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.1.a | Description: The Borrower shall establish and maintain until completion of theProject the UEP headed by a qualified and experienced Project Manager and personnel adequate in numbers to achieve its purposes. |Frequency: Yearly

Finance Agreement: Schedule 2. Section E. 1.a. | Description :Except as the Bank shall otherwise agree, the Borrower undertakesthat the proceeds deposited in the FIAB Principal Account shall be used for the financing and implementation of the project. |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement: Schedule 2. Section I. A.1.b. | Description: The Borrower shall take all such action as shall be necessary tocomply with its obligations under Convenio 171. | Frequency: Yearly

Finance Agreement: Schedule 2. Section I. B.1. | Description: The Borrower shall adopt and thereafter apply in the carrying out ofthe Project an Operational Manual under terms and conditions which shall have been approved by the Bank. | Frequency: Yearly

title.narrative: People under reduced risk of flooding as a result of the Project
Number of hectares reserved as multifunctional areas along the Rio Bogota recuperated under the Project.
Number of multifunctional areas along the Rio Bogota recuperated under the Project.
Length of flood control works constructed under the Project for the Bogota metropolitan area.
Rio Bogota flood control protection standard achieved under the Project (return period in years).
Design flow of the El Salitre WWTP (m3/s)
Biosolids Master Plan for Bogota Distrito Capital developed.

actual.value: Alternative for the Biosolid Management Plan defined.

title.narrative: Integrated water resources management master plan for the Rio Bogota basin developed.
Study for the Design of Multifunctional Areas and the Operation and Maintenance Plan for the flood control works under component 2 completed.
The Salitre WWTP meets effluent discharge limits for BOD, TSS and total coliform
Grievances registered related to the El Salitre WWTP expansion that are addressed
